SENT.plain: 5 cases of an association of Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome and of spinal cord angiomas are reported amongst a series of 150 cases of malformation of the cord
The hypertrophic element, arterial dilatations and varices were found to be constant, in constant to cutaneous angiomatosis which was found in only 2 cases
There were intraspinal angiomas in all cases
The relationship between Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome and regional angiomatous phacomatoses are discussed
